title: US blizzard: Forecasters row back on dire warnings - as it happened | US news | The Guardian
summary: new york and new jersey travel ban in force .
amtrak suspends service between boston and new york .
connecticut travel ban in force now .
nyc mayor de blasio : `` this is the calm before the storm ''

text: this blog is closing now , but my colleague in the thick of it in new york , alan yuhas , will be covering the blizzard at this new blog here .
how long will it take for the media to turn on forecasters and public officials for over-reacting ?
forecasters originally said the storm could bring 1 to 3 feet of snow and punishing hurricane-force winds .
the east coast is starting to wake up to a bad snowstorm - but nothing as dramatic as forecast .
british airways has delayed or cancelled several flights to new york from london this morning , but flights scheduled for departure this afternoon are still on time .
british airways ( @ british airways ) heavy snow in the east coast usa is affecting some flights .
check your flight status here [ 08:01 27jan ]
alex hern has more on those problems at facebook and instagram that caused brief panic among snowbound americans in the north-east .
multiple major social networks failed tuesday morning , including facebook , tinder , instagram , aol instant messenger , and hipchat .
the services have since recovered .
the cause of the outage , which began around 6:20am gmt and ended 40 minutes later , is not yet known .

one leading candidate is an attack on the company 's dns servers , which turn requests for a specific url ( such as facebook.com ) into an actual ip address , which points to one server on the internet .
however the outage occurred , it hit both the websites and apps of the affected services .
facebook-owned instagram returned a ca n't refresh feed '' error , while the facebook website itself simply failed to resolve in the browser .
facebook 's failure seemed to be so major that it has cascaded into app such as tinder that rely on the social network for login functionality .
yet not every facebook-owned service failed .
whatsapp , acquired by mark zuckerberg 's company in february 2014 , remains functional .
facebook has not yet responded to requests for comment , and has not said anything publicly about the outage , although instagram tweeted that it was aware of the failure and working to fix it .
you can read the story in full here .
photos from the not so great blizzard in the us north-east .
jamina goop , from liechtenstein , does a handstand during a snow storm in times square , new york early on tuesday .
latif/reuters workers clear the sidewalks during a snowstorm in times square , new york on tuesday morning .
latif/reuters empty bread shelves at the stop and shop at south bay in boston on monday .
friedman/rick friedman/rick @ rickfriedman.com/corbis
this is mark tran up the baton in london .
it did not long for people to joke about the storms and outages that made facebook and instagram temporarily inaccessible in the us , asia , the uk and australia .
spencer pratt ( @ spencerpratt ) this blizzard is so bad in nyc mayor @ twitterid shut down insta and facebook .
a blizzard warning has been issued for suffolk county in new york .
the advisory warns of severe conditions and dangerous travel conditions : a blizzard warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring .
falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities will lead to whiteout conditions making travel extremely dangerous .
do not travel .
if you must travel have a winter survival kit with you .

my colleague oliver laughland has posted this summary of events so far : snowfall has not yet reached the historic levels predicted in new york city and across the north-east of america , with forecasters beginning to row back from predictions of an historic snowstorm engulfing the region .

governors in states including new york , new jersey , connecticut and massachusetts imposed wide ranging travel bans throughout affected regions , with snowfall as deep as three feet predicted overnight .
in new york city the mayor bill de blasio took the drastic step of closing the subway system , one of the largest and oldest in the world , at 11pm as the travel ban came into play .
all vehicles were banned from roads in 13 counties in new york , with drivers facing $ 300 fines if caught in violation of the restrictions .
by 1:30 est , however , some forecasters appeared to have downgraded the predicted levels of snowfall to around a foot in new york city .
predictions were still as high as two feet in boston , massachusetts .
around 6,500 flights in the region were cancelled , with many not expected for rescheduling until wednesday .
train routes between new york and boston were also cancelled .
national guard troops were also deployed around the north-east to assist first responders .
blizzard warnings and travel bans remain in place throughout the region as heavy snowfall is forecast to continue into tuesday .
i 'll be taking over our live coverage as conditions continue to change throughout the night .

the latest weather updates in new york city indicate that moderate to heavy snow is still expected over the new several hours : ny metro weather ( @ nymetrowx ) in nyc , se ny , far ne nj , ct , li - mod/heavy snow still expected next several hours .
nyc on fringe of heaviest snow as discussed earlier .
ny metro weather ( @ nymetrowx ) for much of southwestern and central nj , becoming clear that our uncertainties earlier were warranted .
heavy snow not making it there .
the national weather service has also cancelled the winter storm warning for philadelphia .

a winter weather advisory will instead be in effect until 3pm est : the national weather service in mount holly has issued a winter weather advisory for snow and blowing snow which is in effect until 3pm est this afternoon .
the winter storm warning has been cancelled .
a winter weather advisory means that periods of snow , sleet or freezing rain can cause travel difficulties , and people are advised to prepare for slippery roads and limited visibility .
just as a reminder to our readers we are continuing to gather of conditions with our guardianwitness assignment .

here 's how readers can help us stay up to date on weather conditions throughout the night : we need you to help be our eyes and ears during the blizzard by sending us your best photos , videos , and stories from the north-east snowstorm .
are you stuck in a traffic jam or facing empty shelves at the supermarket ?
is your train station packed with commuters eager to get home before the shutdowns ?
or are you building snowmen and cuddling up with your pets to wait out the bad weather ?
or are you seeing news much worse than that ?
upload your submissions to guardian witness and we 'll use the best in our live coverage of the storm .

mount holly meteorologist gary szatkowski has tweeted an apology over some of the storm predictions for this evening in the new jersey and philadelphia metropolitan area : gary szatkowski ( @ garyszatkowski ) my deepest apologies to many key decision makers and so many members of the general public .
gary szatkowski ( @ garyszatkowski ) you made a lot of tough decisions expecting us to get it right , and we did n't .
once again , i 'm sorry .

he also said that there are still high impact weather conditions expected for new england , and added that new york city is still likely to see high snowfall : gary szatkowski ( @ garyszatkowski ) this is a big storm further off to our northeast .
new york city will see good amounts of snow , and for portions of new england it will gary szatkowski ( @ garyszatkowski ) be very high impact .
but for much of new jersey , and for the philadelphia metropolitan area , this is a big forecast miss .
here 's an image from the upper west side in manhattan right now , where paul lewis has just filed his latest update and spoke with marty and jackie , below .
while conditions are not ideal , the anticipated levels of snowfall have not yet been reached .
marty and jackie enjoy a stroll through the upper west side near 72nd street as conditions begin to deteriorate in manhattan .
knox
my colleague paul lewis has just provided this further update from manhattan .

people are still waiting to see whether this snowstorm will be as severe as has been expected , but the view from some on the ground is certainly skeptical : cable tv may be warning of a snowpocalypse , but manhattan right now is eerily and even deflatingly quiet .

shortly before midnight the streets were covered with a light dusting of snow and the wind was up , but nothing that seemed out of the ordinary for a january night - except , of course , for the empty streets .
but the snow ploughs and police cars do n't seem to have much to do .
on the upper west side , beside a dog park near 72nd street , i saw a lawyer called marty was enjoying a leisurely stroll and cigar .
it 's only a very small little dutch cigar .
it 's nice for it .
not windy , not cold , '' he said .
his wife , jackie , also a lawyer , concurred .
it 's pretty .
but there is n't enough .
we 're new yorkers .
we want like a lot of fun .
we want two feet of snow , three feet of snow . ''

that sense of mild disappointment was shared with most people who i spoke to who had stepped outdoors nervously expecting to be confronted by what mayor bill de blasio said would be a snowstorm of historic proportions .
that could still happen , of course , and the worst of the weather is still not due to arrive for a few hours .
perhaps prematurely , but people were already speculating whether the mayor would have some explaining to do .

he 's got the cops , the firefighters , the sanitation officers , the snow ploughs , all ready and all guns blazing , '' said a construction worker in fraunces tavern , the only bar open in wall street , eight miles south .
he 's closed the subway so no-one can get home .
he 's thinking this is gon na be the worst storm of the century .
look out the window .
what do you see out there ?
nothing . ''

conditions in new york city are set to rapidly deteriorate '' according to the new york forecasting site , new york metro weather : ny metro weather ( @ nymetrowx ) rapidly deteriorating conditions in manhattan over the next 30 minutes .
same for nj shore , ne nj/se ny near hudson river .
ny metro weather ( @ nymetrowx ) heavy snow being reported at lga and in central park .
my colleague paul lewis has been out in manhattan looking at the consequences of the snowstorm for new york city 's tens of thousands of homeless people .
he spoke to one man , trenton lynton-moore , a 23 year old from texas , trying to find somewhere dry for the night .
here 's paul 's report in full : one consequence of new york shutting the subway at 11pm : homeless people have fewer places to shelter .
i met trenton lynton-moore just now , shortly after he was turfed out of fulton subway station , near wall street .
he stopped me near a cartier jewellery store and asked if i knew where the nearest shelter was .
i told him there was a snowstorm coming .
tonight ? ''
he said .
how long is going to last ? ''
he added : i got , like , four pairs of pants , three pairs of shirts .
blanket , coat .
i just got ta keep from getting wet .
once these get wet , '' he said , pointing to his converse shoes , they 're out .
and the tips are wet already . ''
new york city 's annual count of the homeless population was supposed to take place tonight .
that 's been postponed .
instead , the city has doubled its team of outreach workers , who will spend the night visiting the places homeless people tend to congregate , and ferrying the willing to shelters .
refuges acoss the city like the bowery mission are prepared for the worse and ensuring they have extra capacity .
some transit ports are unofficially opening their doors , too .
shortly before i bumped into lynton-moore i saw a few dozen homeless people gathering at the south ferry terminal and the guards suggested they would let them stay .
but people like lynton-moore , 23 , are harder to reach , and do n't always know where to go .
he 's from dallas , texas , and spent some months recently in colorado , with his uncle , but things did n't work out .
he met someone who was driving to new york .
i came across some money , and i just thought , i 've never actually seen it .
so i 'm going to see it , '' he said .
and here i am . ''
that was two weeks ago .
he has n't wanted to stay in shelters so he 's been sleeping on subway trains .
lynton-moore said he knew there was something wrong with the weather when he walked passed the time warner center and saw a tv reporter a few hours ago .
the man was stood there outside the building , talking to the tv camera .
they were talking about how cold it was .
i stood there watching him for a bit .
but i did n't stay long enough to actually hear there was a snowstorm . ''
trenton lynton-moore a 23 year-old man from dallas , texas .
he is homeless on the night of a snow storm in new york lewis for the guardian
forecasters are still divided over whether the initial predictions of a history making storm were incorrect .
some are forecasting the storm is about to peak : eric fisher ( @ ericfisher ) peak of the storm about to begin .

latest discussion from @ twitterid weather underground ( @ wunderground ) nyc radar shows band of heavy snow inching its way toward metro area whilst others appear to accept their assessments may have been inaccurate : kate bilo cbs3 ( @ katebilo ) please understand that if the storm does n't materialize as expected , nobody is harsher on meteorologists than ourselves .
we know .
the forecast referenced earlier in the blog , published by the weather channel and updated roughly every half an hour , has remained the same .
my colleague nicky woolf has spent the evening down in the bronx at a diner where staff were hoping for some last minute orders of blizzard comfort food .
they did n't quite materialise before the 11pm travel ban .
here 's nicky 's report : in the bronx , the staff of the land and sea diner were prepared for a busy night that has n't arrived , as new yorkers hunkered down for the promised storm .
a few orders of comfort food - soups and steak sandwiches - went out , but de blasio 's warning that the travel ban included delivery drivers had clearly hit home .
delivery drivers stood around , eating fries and listening to calypso music , waiting for a rush - and a blizzard - that never arrived .
a tro fish named wiggly swam laconically in his tank .
the few hardy travellers on the subway , running to catch the last trains back toward manhattan as the 11pm travel deadline drew near , were the exception .
the streets , under curfew , were empty , except for a few police cruisers , flashing lights and spinning wheels in the already-browning slush .
cnn 's don lemon has spent the last few hours driving around the streets of new york in a car he 's named the blizzardmobile .
needless to say , as the storm has n't really hit the city yet , his efforts are being mocked pretty mercilessly on twitter .
and given there 's now a travel ban in the city , some people are asking what the newsreader is doing out there in the first place .
lemon has now reassured viewers that cnn have been given permission by the police to continue driving : craig kanalley ( @ ckanal ) .

@ donlemon as `` blizzardmobile '' traverses nyc 's empty streets : i want people of twitter to know i 'm wearing a seatbelt oliver laughland ( @ oliverlaughland ) don lemon is currently interviewing a # deflategate panel from the # blizzardmobile chris bailey ( @ kentuckyweather ) cnn and the blizzardmobile have nothing on our @ twitterid snowgomobile we send @ twitterid out in .
# kywx # wkytruleswinter

documents.title: new york and new jersey travel ban in force
text: it 's now 11pm and travel bans are in place in 13 counties in new york and throughout new jersey .
bill de blasio ( @ billdeblasio ) starting now , only authorized vehicles are allowed on new york city streets .
please stay off the roads and stay safe .
# safenyc
as was noted earlier in the blog , some forecasters have begun to downgrade their snowfall predictions from the historic levels '' predicted earlier in the day and on sunday .
bill karins ( @ billkarins ) i caved and just lowered # nyc from 16-20 '' down to 10-14 '' and 5 '' already has fallen .
also lowered philly 8-12 '' to 3-6 '' it 's worth noting though that this is not a consensus view and a number of forecasters on tv news are still predicting the levels they have been all day .
all traffic bans remain in place .
it may be cold outside but some lonely souls are using the impending blizzard as a potential tool to meet someone to keep them warm .
dating app tinder is seizing a market opportunity , contrary to the offical message of staying inside and keeping warm : tinder ( @ tinder ) be safe !
happy tindering !
rt : @ twitterid : is everyone gearing up their tinder profiles to find the perfect blizzard bae ? ''

daniel victor ( @ bydanielvictor ) opens tinder sets range for 1 mile edits bio please bring me soup and a dog '' right swipe right swipe right swipe right swipe katherine krueger ( @ kath krueger ) seeking blizzard boyfriend '' is a real thing serious people are posting on the internet rn and then there 's this : jessica roy ( @ jessicakroy ) finally a feminist snowstorm

documents.title: new jersey travel ban from 11pm
text: in important new jersey news , governor christie has announced a travel ban across the state starting from 11pm .
nj oem ( @ readynj ) nj emergency travel ban - executive order
meanwhile , new jersey governor chris christie continues his twitter jokes with new jersey residents .
subjects now up for discussion : pokemon , snow clothes and fires .

governor christie ( @ govchristie ) too cold for the fleece rt @ twitterid real kuzi : wonder if @ twitterid is going to be wearing his fleece tomorrow governor christie ( @ govchristie ) pokemon is still a thing ?
rt @ twitterid : @ twitterid playing some pokemon and enjoying your awesome tweets governor christie ( @ govchristie ) looks awesome rt @ twitterid kruse : @ twitterid

documents.title: updated snowfall forecast
text: the weather channel has recently published an updated snowfall report for the north-eastern states .
it indicates , as has been consistent throughout the day , that areas in the eastern and southern new england region are likely to experience the heaviest snowfall .
the forecast is notably more moderate then some of the figures being quoted on 24 hour news .
here 's a quick , slightly paraphrased , summary .
the full article can be read here : washington , d.c is expected to experience light snow accumulations , with the heaviest amounts likely stay to the north and west of the city .
over 6 inches of snow could fall in the philadelphia area , especially from the city east into southern new jersey .
new york city could see a foot or more of heavy snow .
blizzard conditions are possible .
parts of eastern and southern new england , including boston , providence , rhode island , and portland , maine , have the potential to see 2 feet of snow .
in some areas more than 2 feet of snow could fall , particularly in eastern massachussetts .
the snow will be accompanied by blizzard or near-blizzard conditions .
snowfall rates of 2 to 4 inches per hour are not out of the question during the peak of the storm monday night into tuesday .
thunder and lightning could also accompany the heavy snow .

documents.title: connecticut travel ban in force now
text: in the words of connecticut governor dan malloy : governor dan malloy ( @ govmalloyoffice ) travel ban in # ct is now in effect until further notice .
stay off the roads .
prohibition extends to all vehicles except emergency response .
residents of new york city have just been sent a mobile phone alert reminding them of the 11pm travel restrictions on the road : rupertneate ( @ rupertneate ) woah .

phone just went mental my colleague rupert neate , business correspondent for guardian us , appears somewhat terrified the alert was also sent to his uk mobile : rupertneate ( @ rupertneate ) @ kathviner it even texted my uk phone !
how do they do that ! ?
sidebar !
my colleagues on the guardian us video desk hit the streets of new york city a little earlier today to hear how residents are preparing for the storm .
here 's who they spoke to : new yorkers brace for snow storm : 'you can prepare but you can never be ready ' - video

attention fans of frozen : matt glendinning , head teacher of the moses brown school in providence in rhode island has found a pretty elaborate ( and impressively well produced ) way of telling his pupils there 's no school tomorrow : meanwhile , this apparently happened in new york city a little earlier today : new york , new york ( @ nyc ) 'merica��� # timessquare # nyc # blizzardof2015 # snowmageddon2015 ( image via @ twitterid )
here 's quick gallery of news photos from towns and cities covered in snow around the north-east from earlier today .

in new york city : a woman waits to cross centre street near city hall , new york city kelly/epa in boston : pedestrians walk along a snow-covered path in the boston common senne/ap in jersey city : a jersey city incinerator authority salt and plow truck is seen at newark avenue jersey journal /landov / bar in new haven , connecticut : a man runs through falling snow in new haven , connecticut mcloughlin/reuters in pottsville , pennsylvania faith houser of pottsville , pa. , flies down a snowy hill at general george a. joulwan east side park in pottsville , monday , dormer/ap there are a lot of strong images being posted on social media showing the eerie , empty streets of new york city : joel siegel ( @ joelmsiegel ) no cars , no people & no snow .
14th st. & 9th ave. # blizzardof2015
and another reminder for residents of connecticut : governor dan malloy ( @ govmalloyoffice ) reminder : travel ban in # ct begins at 9pm tonight .
this applies to all roads .
for your safety & the safety of others , stay off the roads
a reminder for residents of new jersey : nj oem ( @ readynj ) the nj transit authority has issued a travel advisory .
all commuters be advised that the last service for all nj transit will be 8pm .
new jersey governor chris christie is using twitter for a few lighthearted interactions with new jersey residents awaiting the full force of the storm .
it seems no question is off limits at the moment : governor christie ( @ govchristie ) it will up at 9pm .
send me a pic in the am .
rt @ twitterid917 : @ twitterid i 'm not impressed governor christie ( @ govchristie ) no .
( so am i ) rt @ twitterid heavey : @ twitterid do you happen to know if dunkin donuts will be open tomorrow ?
i 'm serious .
governor christie ( @ govchristie ) too easy .
rt @ twitterid2016 : hey , @ twitterid , should i be on the beach ?

documents.title: nyc mayor de blasio : `` this is the calm before the storm ''
text: new york city mayor bill de blasio recently finished an address at the department of sanitation 's garage 2 in manhattan as sanitation workers change shift .
this is literally the calm before the storm , '' de blasio said , when it starts in earnest it 's going to come in very fast , very hard . ''
he reminded new yorkers of the travel restrictions imposed from 11pm on the city 's roads , which permits only authorised vehicles to drive in the streets .
plan ahead , '' the mayor said , if you do n't have everything you need , go and get it now . ''
on a human level , look after the people in your neighborhood , '' he added , calling on new yorkers to look our for senior citizens , disabled citizens and the homeless in particular .

documents.title: amtrak suspends service between boston and new york
text: amtrak , the national railway service , has now suspended northeast regional and acela express services between boston and new york for tuesday .
other amtrak services have also been suspended ( see the press release in full below ) .
passengers with services that require modification are being accomodated on other trains are being proactively notified by amtrak customer service , '' the release says .
joseph spector ( @ gannettalbany ) amtrak suspends new england service tuesday - including between albany and nyc
the national weather service in boston has posted this updated map of expected snowfall in the city .
it isolates two areas , one in the east and one in the west , potentially exposed to higher amounts of snow .
nws boston ( @ nwsboston ) generally approx 2 feet across sne w/ iso higher amts of 3 feet .
expect white out conditions ; travel is discouraged :
my colleague kayla epstein has rounded images of the commuters rushing to get home from a little earlier on today .
for a reminder of all the travel restrictions in place around the north-east , have a look at this article we posted earlier .
in boston : midwinter wuff ( @ mikloup ) charles mgh at 5:45 .

cc @ twitterid @ twitterid at the staten island ferry terminal in new york city : miguel negron ( @ officialmigueln ) @ 1010wins staten island bound ferry terminal packed with commuters having an early leave and making their way home .
at penn station from earlier this afternoon : abc news ( @ abc ) nyc transit hubs , including penn station and staten island ferry , packed as people leave manhattan # blizzardof2015

documents.title: 6,500 flights cancelled in north-east
text: over 6,500 flights across the north-eastern states have been cancelled due to the snowstorm with many not due to take off again until wednesday , the associated press reports .
the storm is also proving pretty bad news for showbusiness in new york city .

all shows on broadway have been cancelled , the metropolitan opera house has been forced to cancel the premiere of a new production of tchaikovsky 's iolanta , and comedian louis ck has been forced to cancel a show at madison square garden tomorrow night .
anthony de rosa ( @ antderosa ) here 's the email louis ck sent announcing his msg show tomorrow is cancelled
a reminder from new jersey governor chris christie : governor christie ( @ govchristie ) if your power goes out , you should call your utility company immediately .
do n't assume your utility company already knows .
# blizzardof2015
here 's an updated forecast of snowfall expected in new york city , with many areas potentially in line for up to 36 inches or three feet .
28storms.com ( @ 28storms ) updated expected snowfall totals for nyc area via @ twitterid meanwhile , a parking ban has just come into force in certain areas of boston .
see below for a map of effected areas : city of boston ( @ notifyboston ) parking ban in # boston begins now ( 6pm ) .
here 's a map of where you can & ca n't park # bosnow

and here 's more detail on the road and transit closures in new york , courtesy of a fresh press release from new york governor andrew cuomo : for all local and state roads , a travel ban will go into effect at 11 p.m until further notice in the following 13 counties : bronx , dutchess , kings , nassau , new york , orange , putnam , queens , richmond , rockland , suffolk , ulster , and westchester .
new york city subways and buses will operate only local service beginning at 8 p.m. and service will be suspended beginning at 11 p.m. until further notice .
long island rail road , metro north , staten island railroad service will be suspended beginning at approximately 11 p.m. until further notice .
path service will operate on a weekend schedule beginning at 9 p.m. and be suspended at 11 p.m. until further notice .

a ban on tandem trailers on i-84 , the long island expressway , and the thruway from exit 17 to the new york city line , including on i-287 and i-95 , went into effect at 4 p.m. and remains in effect until further notice .
the release reiterates that only emergency vehicle will be permitted on closed roads , with any violations potentially punishable with a $ 300 fine .
andrew cuomo ( @ nygovcuomo ) after 11pm , only emergency vehicles will be permitted .
travel ban violation is punishable as misdemeanor that includes fines of up to $ 300 .
the metropolitan transport authority ( mta ) of new york has issued further details on planned service closure .

the webpage will keep updating with further information , but here 's the gist : the mta is committed to the safety of its customers and its employees , and due to the forecast , will be suspending service on all bus , commuter rail and subway service at 11:00 p.m. this evening .
if you do n't have to travel between now and later this evening , we urge you to stay home .

to assist those customers who wanted to leave work early ahead of the storm , 26 extra trains were added to lirr and metro-north schedules with those trains departing from penn station and grand central terminal .
prior to full service suspension , express service on several subway lines will be curtailed after the evening rush hour to allow subway trains to be stored underground in anticipation of the storm .
railroad cars will also be moved to locations to protect them from the storm .
my colleagues on the interactive desk have created this useful live photo gallery of traffic camera stills from 20 locations in new york city , boston and other locations bracing for the blizzard .

further to that press conference governor malloy has just announced that bradley international airport , which serves as a civil and military hub , will close at 7pm tonight for all passenger activity .
governor dan malloy ( @ govmalloyoffice ) update : the @ twitterid airport closure at 7pm tonight is for passenger activity
governor malloy reminds connecticut residents that a 9pm travel ban will be in place on the roads and advises people to get off the roads as soon as is possible '' .
he says that all non-essential first and second shift state employees should not report for work tomorrow .
he encourages all businesses in the state to close on tuesday to allow employees to observe the travel ban .
malloy says that 400 national guardsmen have been called up to assist emergency first responders .
connecticut has been down this road before , '' malloy says , we will again weather this storm . ''
welcome to our continued live coverage of the powerful winter storm engulfing states across the north-east of america .
connecticut governor dan malloy is currently updating the press on emergency management plans in the state .
i 'll bring you live updates on that shortly .
below is a summary of how things stand : snow began to accumulate up and down the east coast as residents braced for what forecasters said could be a blizzard of historic proportions .
governors across the northeast declared states of emergencies .
airports and schools were to be closed tuesday .
travel bans were to take effect tuesday night .
the heaviest band of snowfall was expected for eastern long island , connecticut , and eastern massachusetts including the boston area .
wind gusts on long island were projected to reach as high as 70mph .
forecasts for snow from new york city to boston and farther north held steady at 18-36 inches .
a national weather service blizzard warning is in place through early wednesday .
read a state-by-state guide to travel bans and transportation delays .
most public transportation in the region was to be shut down by late tuesday .
each state moved emergency response resources - plows , tow trucks , sand , salt and even national guard troops - into position for quick deployment overnight .
officials warned residents not to go out in the storm and to check on neighbors .
a state-by-state guide to emergency resources is here .
a guide to what to do if you lose power is here .
